title: Simplycallmecollins
author: Simplycallmecollins
content: Funny story: Sometime last year, I got introduced to a "scheme" that claimed it would pay you in BTC without much work. I didn't know much about cryptocurrency then. I wasn't exactly moved because I have a hard time believing in things that come easily and I'm usually suspicious of things I get easily. So... At some point I started buying the idea because I knew some few persons close to me that were making real money from it. You didn't have to refer. I didn't want to be left behind, so my curiosity kicked. I was told if have to get the application, put in some BTC and then buy a mining machine   I got did all the processes voila, I was making money...... At least for the first three days, I was making money. After that week, we were told they wanted to make some upgrade to the app, so we won't be able to place withdrawal at the moment... That was when I knew I was in trouble. Just as I thought, the whole scheme "collapsed" and our money was gone. Ignorance did me bad.So my question boils down to: are cryptocurrency mining machines really real?  I need answers. How do I know what to trust?!

comments.author: bitmover
comments.body: Quote from: Simplycallmecollins on November 23, 2022, 06:31:50 PMSo my question boils down to: are cryptocurrency mining machines really real?  I need answers. How do I know what to trust?!Your whole story is just a scam. About your question: yes, mining is real. You can mine bitcoin while you sleep.But you need to pay for the electricity and for the hardware . And they are both expensive No free lunch .

comments.author: Freeveto
comments.body: There are a lot of scam Bitcoin mining firms out there that claims to mine BTC and I have once fall a victim too,  while in the other hands there are still good ones too but they're rare to find. If you're looking for such mining machine that mines Bitcoin , I guess someone with much better information to that will respond to you .

comments.author: stompix
comments.body: Quote from: Simplycallmecollins on November 23, 2022, 06:31:50 PMSo my question boils down to: are cryptocurrency mining machines really real?  I need answers. How do I know what to trust?!Yes, very real, if there was no mining gear there would be no working blockchain now.But cloud mining, mining apps, all those schemes with 100% to 1000% monthly returns are just scams.With profitability down the drain there is no way to make money right now even with mining companies that were almost legit, like bitdeer.So, avoid them like the plague.QuoteAt least for the first three days, I was making money.Virtual money, numbers in a script that showed you what the owner wanted, as real as gold coins in an RPG game.

comments.author: CryptoHeadlineNews
comments.body: Quote from: Simplycallmecollins on November 23, 2022, 06:31:50 PMSo my question boils down to: are cryptocurrency mining machines really real?  I need answers. How do I know what to trust?!To answer your question,  cryptocurrency mining is real, but one has to use the right mining equipment for such to be successful. So on that note, I will like to ask just only two questions.1. What mining equipment did you buy or used for your mining journey, or was it just a mere online mining? Because most are scams2. Did you make any deligent research about it before investing or you just went into it just because of the review of a few?This should be a lesson to you from today to never invest in what promises a reward too good to be true, as thats the first red-flag of a potential scam

comments.author: Piesel
comments.body: Cloud mining is 100% scam, and if ever have anything to do with such then just know that you will definitely lose your money.Cryptocurrency mining requires a lot of processes and one is not careful owning a coin as a reward from individual mining is almost impossible right now, since it requires equipment and technicality to do so a lot of software, and hardware is needed with steady electricity to keep the devices running 24/7.

comments.author: Dunamisx
comments.body: Quote from: Simplycallmecollins on November 23, 2022, 06:31:50 PMSo my question boils down to: are cryptocurrency mining machines really real?  I need answers. How do I know what to trust?!Mining machines are real but here we have to be specific with which type of mining machine are we referring to, we have bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies mining machines, we have dome that are reliable to be trusted like that of antminer while the cloud miner aren't trusted because they ended up being like scamming faucets that does not pay you after alot of invested efforts on mining it, they are but just a generator of traffic and the little incentives they generate are only maintained to themselves . Without paying others involved through the mining process, but the blockchain mining of bitcoin requires alot of devices and technical set up arrangements to make because it is the only genuine mining process.

comments.author: CryptoPanda
comments.body: Quote from: Simplycallmecollins on November 23, 2022, 06:31:50 PMSo my question boils down to: are cryptocurrency mining machines really real?Yes bitcoin mining is real, Bitcoin mining is very expensive and unless you’re a millionaire I suggest you find something else to do to earn bitcoins. There are lots of challenges miners face, first you have to buy the necessary hardware and you also need electricity for your farm, nowadays you need to confirm if bitcoin mining is allowed in your region. Quote from: Simplycallmecollins on November 23, 2022, 06:31:50 PMHow do I know what to trust?!Never trust the freebies. There’s nothing free on the chess board only gambits, it’s sad you lost your money hoping to get a bigger reward but it’s a good lesson to have as a beginner. People often fall for cloud mining scams because they feel it’s a cheaper way to get Bitcoins. Personally I think the era of accumulating free bitcoins from online games, faucets, are long gone. In 2022, the only way to get bitcoin is to buy some.

comments.author: Apocollapse
comments.body: There's no such make Bitcoin while you sleep, if we talking about the real mining rigs that you must have decent knowledge and start to mine on your home, you wouldn't get any profit after 3 days since the electricity cost and your initial capital is huge, you wouldn't make any profit for short time. Setting up mining rigs is quite hard for newbies, I don't think you will sleep well even though your mining machine already start to mine, because you need to check your mining machines few times.

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: Quote from: Simplycallmecollins on November 23, 2022, 06:31:50 PMHow do I know what to trust?!You do not, so you do not get to trust anything or anyone. That's the exact point of being your own bank, as you are with Bitcoin; you do not trust, rather you verify.Do not even trust that your friends are "making" money out of it, a quick search on how to mine Bitcoin would have revealed how a Bitcoin mining app is 100% a scam and would have deterred you from sending anything to them.You already have a natural inclination to be skeptical and that's good, you just need to complement that with deep research on anything you intend to throw money into.

comments.author: Silberman
comments.body: Quote from: Simplycallmecollins on November 23, 2022, 06:31:50 PMSo my question boils down to: are cryptocurrency mining machines really real?  I need answers. How do I know what to trust?!Mining is real and profits can be generated if you know what you are doing, however scammers take advantage of it by adding a twist to it, they promise you to obtain a lot of profits and hope the greed of the people to do the rest, and unfortunately as you have experimented by yourself the scam works and people lose their money, so I recommend to you that you stay away from any offer like that, and if you are genuinely interested in this market then you can invest in bitcoin and do your best to hold your coins.

comments.author: Obari
comments.body: I'm glad you gone passed it and learnt your lesson.From your story, it seems you were introduced to cloud mining which is actually a scam and Dem my research, there were actual cloud miners that paid real money but not certain if any works currently and if they do, then it wouldn't have to pay anything reasonable.Bitcoin mining is real and one can mine Bitcoin but I really don't see it work it since it is very expensive unless you're willing to pay for the electric bills and also the mining rigs which are mostly expensive.There is no free Bitcoin anymore and for every Bitcoin you earn now,there must be a price to pay for it.

comments.author: noorman0
comments.body: Since the debut of the business idea, “Cloud mining” has been more like ponzi with many people getting lured into an unwitting scheme. Of course this service should not be trusted at all.Quote from: Simplycallmecollins on November 23, 2022, 06:31:50 PM-snip-we were told they wanted to make some upgrade to the appThat's the funny part, instead of charging customers a fee to upgrade their mining hardware, they finance upgrades of apps that are clearly not needed.

And there are thousands of people earning bitcoins by mining for free. And you can earn free bitcoins by mining from there if you want.

comments.author: philipma1957
comments.body: Cloud mining is terrible.A) company is fully fake and folds in a few months.B) company is legit some are, but all legit companies have the “we can fuck you anytime we want clause”I had a great contract with some bitmain based company. It was fall of 2017.BTC was whaling so bitmain canceled the contract and paid it off early since my profits would have been huge if they let it run its course.So if you use bitdeer (bitmain based) and profits go negative they cancel you lose and if profits go high they cancel and you get far lower profits then you would have.So if you do a legit company you need btc and difficulty to be very very very stable and you make a small profit.Or buy a small miner the Apollo and mine with that in your home.And hold the very small amount of coins it makes for a decade or more.
